general_advisory: Hold the irrigation for next few days as rainfall is expected. Make drainage to remove excess water from the field. Make arrangement to store rainwater for further use in irrigation. Harvest the paddy as soon as possible. Postpone the spraying activities for few days.

advisory: Harvest the paddy as early as possible.
Keep the harvested ones at safe and dry places.
If harvesting cannot be completed before the rain occurs, leave it to dry under the sun for few more days.
Postpone spraying activities for the next few days.
Maintain plant population by thinning the plants.
Make drainage to remove excess water from the field in case of excess rainfall.

Provide smoke to the crops to reduce the chilling injury.
Alternaria leaf blight in chickpea can be reduced by spraying Mancozeb @ 2.5 g/lt.
Powdery mildew in chickpea may be seen in near future. To manage the same, spray Dithane M-45 @ 2.5 g/lt.
Spraying should be done after the rainfall activity.
Drain out excess water from the field if waterlogging condition prevails.
Protect the crop from cold waves.
Make sure to maintain the spacing and plant population.
Remove any weeds present within the crop.
Regularly keep a watch on the diseases.
Postpone irrigation till the next advisory.
Harvest the matured fruits.
Provide staking to the plants.
Fruit and shoot borer in tomato plants can be managed by spraying Flubendiamide 20 WG @ 2g/10lt or Emamectin benzoate 4%SG @ 4 g/10lt of water.
Remove weeds from the field.
Cauliflower borer can be managed by manually destroying the borers.
In case of heavy infestation spray Cartap hydrochloride @ 6 g/15 lts.
Downy mildew disease in Cauliflower can be reduced by spraying Metalaxyl @ 4g/lt.
Spraying activities should be continued after 3-4 days.
Provide irrigation to the crops.
Pinching process should be done to encourage branching.
Powdery mildew disease can be controlled by spraying Wettable sulphur powder.
Pruning of rose plant is necessary to encourage new flushes of branches.
Mealy bug infestation may be seen in the plants. Keep a watch on it.
Provide support to the plant where banana bunch have emerged.
Cover the bunch with gunny bags to protect from the rain and monkeys.
